com.ae.apps.common.fragments

Class PermissionCheckingFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • com.ae.apps.common.fragments.PermissionCheckingFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public abstract class PermissionCheckingFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
    An abstract Fragment that can check for Runtime Permissions if your app target is above Lollipop The onCreateView method is used to check for the permission and returns an empty FrameLayout to the Activity that hosts this fragment. Based on the permission check result, the below methods would be invoked and can return the appropriate View for that scenario setupViewWithPermission(android.os.Bundle) If permission is granted setupViewWithoutPermission() If permission is not granted
